title: How to Draw a Boat

steps.headline: Sketch a long oblong.
Sketch a line 2/3 of the oblong.
Draw 2 curved line along the mid-line.
Add the primary sketch of the bottom of the kayak.
Draw a curvy line along the primary sketch of the bottom of the kayak.
steps.description: Also, draw the hole for the person to sit on by drawing a half circle.

steps.headline: Sketch a straight line for handle of the oar/paddle.
Sketch the basic shape for the blade of the oar/paddle.
Draw the basic outline of the boat.
Erase unnecessary lines.
steps.description: Put more details into your sketch.

steps.headline: Color the kayak.
steps.description: Use colors that would match the background or colors that create a unique design boat.

steps.headline: Sketch the main body of the sailboat.
steps.description: Start by drawing a trapezoid shape.

steps.headline: Sketch a line perpendicular to the body of the boat.
steps.description: Next, draw a small trapezoid where this line is connected to the boat.

steps.headline: Sketch another line.
steps.description: This time, place the line perpendicular to the first. Add more details to the stand of the mast.

steps.headline: Add the shape of the sails.
steps.description: Do this by drawing triangles, then add a line just above the body of the boat.

steps.headline: Add the guidelines for the distinct shape of the boat.
Draw the basic outline of the boat.
Erase the pencil marks.
steps.description: Add a few extra details, as you see fit.

steps.headline: Color the boat.
Sketch an upside-down, truncated triangle in the middle of the page.
steps.description: This will be the body of the boat.

steps.headline: Draw a triangle on top of the base.
Draw a few squares on the triangle.
Outline the shape of the boat.
steps.description: Add in details, such as wooden planks on the boat's body, a small lifesaver, and a mast behind the sails.

steps.headline: Erase the sketch lines.
Add in the color.
steps.description: Follow the illustration for reference or color as you please.

methods.name: Drawing a Realistic Style Wooden Boat

steps.headline: Sketch a big teardrop shape in the middle of the page.
steps.description: This will be the top part of the boat.

steps.headline: Under the teardrop shape draw a long arch.
steps.description: This will be the body of the boat.

steps.headline: Outline the boat's shape.
steps.description: Add in the details, inside and outside of the boat. Follow the illustration for reference.

steps.headline: Erase the sketch lines.
steps.description: Strengthen the contour with a pencil.

steps.headline: Make the boat colorful using the colors of your choice.

tyn: Colored pencils, crayons, markers or watercolors
text: Drawing a Kayak Sketch a long oblong.  Sketch a line 2/3 of the oblong.  Draw 2 curved line along the mid-line.  Add the primary sketch of the bottom of the kayak.  Draw a curvy line along the primary sketch of the bottom of the kayak. Also, draw the hole for the person to sit on by drawing a half circle. Sketch a straight line for handle of the oar/paddle.  Sketch the basic shape for the blade of the oar/paddle.  Draw the basic outline of the boat.  Erase unnecessary lines. Put more details into your sketch. Color the kayak. Use colors that would match the background or colors that create a unique design boat. Drawing a Sailboat Sketch the main body of the sailboat. Start by drawing a trapezoid shape. Sketch a line perpendicular to the body of the boat. Next, draw a small trapezoid where this line is connected to the boat. Sketch another line. This time, place the line perpendicular to the first. Add more details to the stand of the mast. Add the shape of the sails. Do this by drawing triangles, then add a line just above the body of the boat. Add the guidelines for the distinct shape of the boat.  Draw the basic outline of the boat.  Erase the pencil marks. Add a few extra details, as you see fit. Color the boat.  Drawing a Traditional Ship Sketch an upside-down, truncated triangle in the middle of the page. This will be the body of the boat. Draw a triangle on top of the base.  Draw a few squares on the triangle. These will be the sails. Outline the shape of the boat. Add in details, such as wooden planks on the boat's body, a small lifesaver, and a mast behind the sails. Erase the sketch lines. Make the contour stronger. Add in the color. Follow the illustration for reference or color as you please. Drawing a Realistic Style Wooden Boat Sketch a big teardrop shape in the middle of the page. This will be the top part of the boat. Under the teardrop shape draw a long arch. This will be the body of the boat. Outline the boat's shape. Add in the details, inside and outside of the boat. Follow the illustration for reference. Erase the sketch lines. Strengthen the contour with a pencil. Make the boat colorful using the colors of your choice.
sentences: Drawing a Kayak Sketch a long oblong.
Sketch a line 2/3 of the oblong.
Draw 2 curved line along the mid-line.
Add the primary sketch of the bottom of the kayak.
Draw a curvy line along the primary sketch of the bottom of the kayak.
Also, draw the hole for the person to sit on by drawing a half circle.
Sketch a straight line for handle of the oar/paddle.
Sketch the basic shape for the blade of the oar/paddle.
Draw the basic outline of the boat.
Erase unnecessary lines.
Put more details into your sketch.
Color the kayak.
Use colors that would match the background or colors that create a unique design boat.
Drawing a Sailboat Sketch the main body of the sailboat.
Start by drawing a trapezoid shape.
Sketch a line perpendicular to the body of the boat.
Next, draw a small trapezoid where this line is connected to the boat.
Sketch another line.
This time, place the line perpendicular to the first.
Add more details to the stand of the mast.
Add the shape of the sails.
Do this by drawing triangles, then add a line just above the body of the boat.
Add the guidelines for the distinct shape of the boat.
Draw the basic outline of the boat.
Erase the pencil marks.
Add a few extra details, as you see fit.
Color the boat.
Drawing a Traditional Ship Sketch an upside-down, truncated triangle in the middle of the page.
This will be the body of the boat.
Draw a triangle on top of the base.
Draw a few squares on the triangle.
These will be the sails.
Outline the shape of the boat.
Add in details, such as wooden planks on the boat's body, a small lifesaver, and a mast behind the sails.
Erase the sketch lines.
Make the contour stronger.
Add in the color.
Follow the illustration for reference or color as you please.
Drawing a Realistic Style Wooden Boat Sketch a big teardrop shape in the middle of the page.
This will be the top part of the boat.
Under the teardrop shape draw a long arch.
This will be the body of the boat.
Outline the boat's shape.
Add in the details, inside and outside of the boat.
Follow the illustration for reference.
Erase the sketch lines.
Strengthen the contour with a pencil.
Make the boat colorful using the colors of your choice.
